stem: The nurse is caring for a client who is one day post-operative following a lumbar laminectomy. Which of the following nursing actions are essential for this client's care? Select all that apply.

options.text: Encourage the client to twist at the waist to promote mobility.
Administer pain medication only when the client reports severe pain.
Assess the client's pain level regularly.
Encourage deep breathing and coughing exercises.
Limit fluid intake to prevent urinary retention.
Monitor for signs of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) leakage.
Elevate the head of the bed to 60 degrees.

rationale.correct: Maintaining proper body alignment prevents complications and promotes healing. Logrolling the client ensures the spine remains aligned during turning. Assessing pain level helps in managing the client's comfort. Encouraging deep breathing and coughing prevents respiratory complications. Monitoring for signs of CSF leakage helps in early detection of potential complications.
rationale.mnemonic: LAMB: Logroll, Assess pain, Monitor CSF, Breathe deeply
rationale.incorrect: Encouraging the client to twist at the waist can disrupt spinal alignment and impede healing. Administering pain medication only when the client reports severe pain may lead to inadequate pain management. Limiting fluid intake can lead to dehydration and constipation. Elevating the head of the bed more than 30 degrees can cause undue stress on the surgical site.
rationale.questionTrap: The question requires the nurse to identify essential actions, distinguishing them from actions that are contraindicated or less important.
clinicalPearls: Post-operative lumbar laminectomy care focuses on maintaining spinal alignment, managing pain, and preventing complications.
Logrolling is a technique used to turn the client while maintaining spinal alignment.

itemContext.sbar: John Smith is a 55-year-old male, one day post-operative lumbar laminectomy. He reports pain at the surgical site and difficulty with mobility.
